commit_message:
Add 2023.1 (Antelope) prelude

Change-Id: I19abe84dac7f0b8d370b5eb1dfb073d2e708bc03
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/54/877354/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: | Welcome to the 2023.1 (Antelope) release of the OpenStack Block Storage service (cinder). With this release, we added several drivers and driver features as follows: * Added HPE XP iSCSI and FC, Fungible NVMe-TCP, NetApp NVMe-TCP storage drivers. * Added Features like Trisync replication support for Pure driver, volume group snapshot support for IBM SVF driver, Unisphere 10 support for Dell EMC PowerMax driver and Host assisted migration and retype support for Hitachi VSP driver.

While copying a volume (sometimes an intermediate step to break volume
dependency), we send a request to clone the source volume to a destination
volume but all the exceptions aren't handled properly.

For instance, an HTTPConflict is raised due to various reasons as listed
here[1]. One of such reasons in not even mentioned in the 3par client which
is ERROR 32 i.e. volume has children.

This patch adds the handling of the case as similarly handled when deleting
a volume in cinder 3par driver[2] i.e. to delete the temp snapshots of that
volume and try the delete again (In our case, we try to copy operation again).

[1] https://github.com/hpe-storage/python-3parclient/blob/26094f3011237795f0c5efb24faf04560c72f4a4/hpe3parclient/client.py#L921-L1001

commit_message:
3PAR: Error out if vol cannot be converted to base

Consider volume and snapshots as below:

v1
|
`-- s1
    |
    `-- v2
        |
        `-- s2

User initiated deletion of snapshot s1.
It failed with some vague message.

Initially, it was suspected that ...
While copying volume v2 (sometimes an intermediate step to break
volume dependency), we send a request to clone the volume v2 to new
base volume; and the exception [1] isn't handled properly.

[1] Conflict (HTTP 409) 32 - volume has a child

However, on further investigation it was found that ...
after a new volume v2 (omv-<id>) is created and
when we try to delete old volume v2 (osv-<id>),
at this point the exception [1] is thrown as error.

This is now handled gracefully. Appropriate error is thrown
if the volume (v2) has snapshot (s2).

Co-Authored-By: raghavendrat <raghavendra-uddhav.tilay@hpe.com>
Closes-Bug: #1994521
Change-Id: I5e7fb425c92cdf8c16d5a86a58ca1a52421543d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/79/862679/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: task_id = self._copy_volume(volume_name, temp_vol_name, cpg, cpg, type_info['tpvv'], type_info['tdvv'], compression) except hpeexceptions.HTTPConflict as ex: if (ex.get_code() == 32): # Error 32 means that the volume has children # see if we have any temp snapshots snaps = self.client.getVolumeSnapshots(volume_name) for snap in snaps: if snap.startswith('tss-'): # looks like we found a temp snapshot. LOG.info( "Found a temporary snapshot %(name)s", {'name': snap}) try: self.client.deleteVolume(snap) except hpeexceptions.HTTPNotFound: # if the volume is gone, it's as good as a # successful delete pass except Exception: msg = _("Volume has a temporary snapshot that " "can't be deleted at this time.") raise exception.VolumeIsBusy(message=msg) task_id = self._copy_volume(volume_name, temp_vol_name, cpg, cpg, type_info['tpvv'], type_info['tdvv'], compression) else: raise ex
deleted_lines: task_id = self._copy_volume(volume_name, temp_vol_name, cpg, cpg, type_info['tpvv'], type_info['tdvv'], compression)

commit_message:
Correct release note formatting

The release note for change Icf3c8dc4ba2fd96cda0 was not consistent
in second-level list spacing and thus sphinx changed some lists into
really large blockquotes.  Also, change one of the lists to a
description list so the info is displayed more clearly.

Change-Id: Id5fa35afc2ad89dec4c9029a01efe01196fd794e

commit_message:
Follow up: Hitachi: Change option name `hitachi_pool` to `hitachi_pools`

This patch changes option name ``hitachi_pool`` to ``hitachi_pools`` and
sets ``hitachi_pool`` as deprecated name, along review comment[*1]
On the related patch[*2], we've supported MULTIPLE pools,
but option name is still ``hitachi_pool``.

[1] review comment:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/846977/2/cinder/volume/drivers/hitachi/hbsd_common.py#52
[2] Related-Id: I49ac061011293900b04a7a5b90ff5b840521993d

A parent patch is not the related patch, why diffrent is we would like
to avoid re-uploading this patch by rebase when parent patch is merged.

Change-Id: If31edee3c8d51300b01272cf29e31f6ad3e9dc4f

commit_message:
Fix: PowerMax test with flipping force flag

This patch fixes the error faced in a recent gate run[1].
This is a random behavior but there are other places where
similar change is required.
Since the whole powermax unit tests need to be refactored to do
this correctly, this patch only addresses the failure faced in
the gate run.

[1] https://storage.gra.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_bd9/852654/16/gate/openstack-tox-py310/bd9f0d9/testr_results.html

Change-Id: I6dacbb2aba37dac27ad741aee01cd4f1355198cb

commit_message:
Remove deleted projects from flavor access list

Previously Nova was unable to remove deleted projects from flavor's
access lists. This patch lifts described limitation and improves
logic of nova/api/openstack/identity.py library by introducing two
separate kinds of exceptions:

- webob.exc.HTTPInternalServerError is raised when Keystone identity
  service version 3.0 was not found.
- webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest is raised when specified project is not
  found.

Closes-bug: #1980845
Change-Id: Icbf3bdd944f9a6c38f25ddea0b521ca48ee87a7f
(cherry picked from commit 8c6daaacbedc33e738ce85aec0ead5f6947d60bf)

It may be reasonable to switch to HTTP 503 # (HTTP Service Unavailable) instead of HTTP Bad Request here. # If proper Keystone servie is inaccessible, then technially # this is a server side error and not an error in Nova. raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) msg = _("Project ID %s is not a valid project.") % project_id raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg)

This might " "be because your endpoint points to the v2.0 versioned endpoint " "which is not supported. Please fix this.") raise failure raise failure

commit_message:
Shut up pylint about win32_disk_size

The pylint job is non-voting, but it was annoying to see it fail.

To add the insult to injury, the code was correct, but the pylint
was not smart enough. So this patch only exists to address
shortcomings of our toolchain.

Change-Id: I391e03426c42b7af122722cd851c4aa03f2dcb68

commit_message:
remove unicode prefix from code

All strings are considered as unicode string from Python 3.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
appearances from the unicode strings.

Change-Id: I7495987b6c629a05373f2519ddab2f77adec6c13

commit_message:
DNM: Add CI Job For lvm+ceph With c-bak Enabled

This patch adds a non-voting job to test backup and multibackend
features, such as restoring backups from different volume types.

Depends-On: Iff8e1e90ab3c7b519819577ec3aafff838e6934f
Change-Id: I46ce4c994d62c6304360dde64d6f2eeaa646c1bf

commit_message:
Ensure service is restarted on unit file changes

At the moment we don't restart services if systemd unit file is changed.

We knowingly prevent systemd_service role handlers to execute
by providing `state: started` as otherwise service will be restarted twice.
With that now  we ensure that role handlers will also listen for systemd
unit changes.

Change-Id: I8ce4f18e853ee0c55970012f4c40574960607441

commit_message:
Switch back to use constrained Django version

Supposedly, Adjutant has upgraded used Django version and constrained
version can be used now, since upper limit for Django is not defined
anymore in project requirements [1]

We also fix ansible_facts usage with same commit to resolve
circular dependency.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/adjutant/src/commit/df8c3e4a8b70be8697ac46f0acec9169752b4698/requirements.txt#L3

Change-Id: Ie5c4f5528a25d0a13c12749c1d7af09377792342

The information we should be used for the calculations is returned in

This patch uses ``stored`` when present and fallbacks to ``bytes_used``

commit_message:
RBD: Fix total_capacity

Ceph has changed the meaning of the ``bytes_used`` column in the pools
reported by the ``df`` command, which means that in some deployments the
rbd driver is not reporting the expected information ot the schedulers.

The information we should be used for the calculations is returned in
the ``stored`` field in those systems.

This patch uses ``stored`` when present and fallbacks to ``bytes_used``
if not.

Closes-Bug: #1960206
Change-Id: I0ca25789a0b279d82f766091235f24f429405da6
(cherry picked from commit 86d9ec5d5932557ade18e7893cc2b8f564b5b2d8)

added_lines: @ddt.data( # Normal case, no quota and dynamic total {'free_capacity': 27.0, 'total_capacity': 28.44}, # No quota and static total {'dynamic_total': False, 'free_capacity': 27.0, 'total_capacity': 59.96}, # Quota and dynamic total {'quota_max_bytes': 3221225472, 'max_avail': 1073741824, 'free_capacity': 1, 'total_capacity': 2.44}, # Quota and static total {'quota_max_bytes': 3221225472, 'max_avail': 1073741824, 'dynamic_total': False, 'free_capacity': 1, 'total_capacity': 3.00}, # Quota and dynamic total when free would be negative {'quota_max_bytes': 1073741824, 'free_capacity': 0, 'total_capacity': 1.44}, ) @ddt.unpack @common_mocks def test_get_pool_nautilus(self, free_capacity, total_capacity, max_avail=28987613184, quota_max_bytes=0, dynamic_total=True): client = self.mock_client.return_value client.__enter__.return_value = client client.cluster.mon_command.side_effect = [ (0, '{"stats":{"total_bytes":64385286144,' '"total_used_bytes":3289628672,"total_avail_bytes":61095657472},' '"pools":[{"name":"rbd","id":2,"stats":{"kb_used":1510197,' '"stored":1546440971,"bytes_used":4639322913,"max_avail":%s,' '"objects":412}},{"name":"volumes","id":3,"stats":{"kb_used":0,' '"bytes_used":0,"max_avail":28987613184,"objects":0}}]}\n' % max_avail, ''), (0, '{"pool_name":"volumes","pool_id":4,"quota_max_objects":0,' '"quota_max_bytes":%s}\n' % quota_max_bytes, ''), ] with mock.patch.object(self.driver.configuration, 'safe_get', return_value=dynamic_total): result = self.driver._get_pool_stats() client.cluster.mon_command.assert_has_calls([ mock.call('{"prefix":"df", "format":"json"}', b''), mock.call('{"prefix":"osd pool get-quota", "pool": "rbd",' ' "format":"json"}', b''), ]) self.assertEqual((free_capacity, total_capacity), result)

commit_message:
Add test for hpe _get_updated_comment

Test covers retrival and update of comment during volume migration.
Validating the results of function.

Change-Id: I3ba54523264a7a99823ae17151405254382ecbd7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/45/878745/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: comment_expected.append(self.driver._get_updated_comment('osv-0DM4qZEVSKON-DXN-NwVpw', #mock_get_comment.assert_has_calls(comment_expected) def test_get_updated_comment(self, vol_name, **values): """Test the following -validate the volume -Check if the right comment is being retrieved -validate if update works """ vol = self.client.getVolume(vol_name) comment = vol.get('commment') #assert if retrieved comment is valid assert isinstance(comment, Comment) #Check if correct comment is retrieved expected_comment = [ "display_name": "foo Volume", "volume_id": self.Clone_ID, "_name_id": None ] self.assertEqual(expected_comment, comment) #Check if the comment has been updated actual_comment = _get_updated_comment(vol_name, **values) self.assertEqual(expected_comment, actual_comment) #have not tested yet would appreciate feedback before proceeding

subject: Remove multiatttach request parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-04-05 23:18:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/6df7c83f18e8ec579c02eb48886c19673592539a', 'message': 'Remove multiatttach request parameter

The initial cinder design[1][2][3] allowed users to create mutliattach
volumes by spcifying the ``multiattach`` parameter in the request
body of volume create operation (``--allow-multiattach`` option in
cinderclient).

This functionality changed in Queens with the introduction of
microversion 3.50[4] where we used volume types to store
the multiattach capabilities. Any volume created with a multiattach
volume type will be a multiattach volume[5].

While implementing the new functionality, we had to keep backward
compatibility with the *old way* of creating multiattach volumes.
We deprecated the ``multiattach`` (``--allow-multiattach`` on cinderclient
side) parameter in the queens release[6][7].
We also removed the support of the ``--allow-multiattach`` optional
parameter from cinderclient in the train release[8] but the API
side never removed the compatibility code to disallow functionality
of creating multiattach volumes by using the ``multiattach``
parameter (instead of a multiattach volume type).

This patch removes the support of providing the ``multiattach``
parameter in the request body of a volume create operation and will
fail with a BadRequest exception stating the reason of failure
and how it can be fixed.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/multi-attach-volume
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/85847/
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-cinderclient/+/85856
[4] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/f1bfd9790d2a7cac9a3e66417b11dc8e3edd8109
[5] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/admin/volume-multiattach.html#how-to-create-a-multiattach-volume
[6] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/94dbf5cce2caff484460a1330feb6cbf7f3dd56a
[7] https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/adb141a2626192e8f45a911291895716d7c1c8a4
[8] https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/3c1b417959689c85a2f54505057ca995fedca075

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/875372
Closes-Bug: 2008259

Change-Id: I0ece6e279048abcc04b3674108290a80eca6bd62
(cherry picked from commit 32f1145b7ddf9a9a359e2359e7db63dbdd00b899)
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-04-05 23:54:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/affd973ff035883897683b7d30dc5d458871bb74', 'message': 'Remove multiatttach request parameter

The initial cinder design[1][2][3] allowed users to create mutliattach
volumes by spcifying the ``multiattach`` parameter in the request
body of volume create operation (``--allow-multiattach`` option in
cinderclient).

This functionality changed in Queens with the introduction of
microversion 3.50[4] where we used volume types to store
the multiattach capabilities. Any volume created with a multiattach

While implementing the new functionality, we had to keep backward

We deprecated the ``multiattach`` (``--allow-multiattach`` on cinderclient
side) parameter in the queens release[6][7].
We also removed the support of the ``--allow-multiattach`` optional
parameter from cinderclient in the train release[8] but the API

of creating multiattach volumes by using the ``multiattach``

This patch removes the support of providing the ``multiattach``

commit_message:
Remove multiatttach request parameter

The initial cinder design[1][2][3] allowed users to create mutliattach
volumes by spcifying the ``multiattach`` parameter in the request
body of volume create operation (``--allow-multiattach`` option in
cinderclient).

This functionality changed in Queens with the introduction of
microversion 3.50[4] where we used volume types to store
the multiattach capabilities. Any volume created with a multiattach
volume type will be a multiattach volume[5].

While implementing the new functionality, we had to keep backward
compatibility with the *old way* of creating multiattach volumes.
We deprecated the ``multiattach`` (``--allow-multiattach`` on cinderclient
side) parameter in the queens release[6][7].
We also removed the support of the ``--allow-multiattach`` optional
parameter from cinderclient in the train release[8] but the API
side never removed the compatibility code to disallow functionality
of creating multiattach volumes by using the ``multiattach``
parameter (instead of a multiattach volume type).

This patch removes the support of providing the ``multiattach``
parameter in the request body of a volume create operation and will
fail with a BadRequest exception stating the reason of failure
and how it can be fixed.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/multi-attach-volume
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/85847/
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-cinderclient/+/85856
[4] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/f1bfd9790d2a7cac9a3e66417b11dc8e3edd8109
[5] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/admin/volume-multiattach.html#how-to-create-a-multiattach-volume
[6] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/94dbf5cce2caff484460a1330feb6cbf7f3dd56a
[7] https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/adb141a2626192e8f45a911291895716d7c1c8a4
[8] https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/3c1b417959689c85a2f54505057ca995fedca075

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/875372
Closes-Bug: 2008259

Change-Id: I0ece6e279048abcc04b3674108290a80eca6bd62
(cherry picked from commit 32f1145b7ddf9a9a359e2359e7db63dbdd00b899)
(cherry picked from commit e2c3bcc6e380921bbe283b4a1b173216193c753d)
Conflicts: api-ref/source/v3/parameters.yaml
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/95/879695/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | `Bug #2008259 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/2008259>`_: Fixed the volume create functionality where non-admin users were able to create multiattach volumes by providing the `multiattach` parameter in the request body. Now we can only create multiattach volumes using a multiattach volume type, which is also the recommended way. other: - | Removed the ability to create multiattach volumes by specifying `multiattach` parameter in the request body of a volume create operation. This functionality is unsafe, can lead to data loss, and has been deprecated since the Queens release. The recommended method for creating a multiattach volume is to use a volume type that supports multiattach. By default, volume types can only be created by the operator. Users who have a need for multiattach volumes should contact their operator if a suitable volume type is not available.

commit_message:
Restore into sparse volumes

We take the approach to detect zero data when restoring and not
writing it out to the volume. This works exactly as expected
when restoring into Linux LVM volumes and into Ceph RBD volumes,
provided they are freshly created.

Closes-bug: #2007615
Change-Id: I54b81a568a01af44e3f74bcac55e823cdae9bfbf
(cherry picked from commit 477b1342747ddeb3ab9a586b33c06f1e51f37df8)

commit_message:
[train only] update gate jobs

1. Given that "upgrades from Extended Maintenance are not supported
within the Community" [0], move the grenade jobs to the experimental
queue for the stable branches in EM status.  Additionally, remove
the integrated-gate [1] and integrated-gate-storage [2] templates
that include grenade.  The relevant non-grenade jobs in these
templates are either already configured in our .zuul.yaml or are
added in this patch.

2. The pep8 job has been failing in the gate when it runs
check_exec.py.  Looks like the shebang in that file is causing the
system python to be used instead of the testenv python, so remove
the shebang from the file and change the way the file is invoked
by tox.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#extended-maintenance
[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/commit/cb57f26b0db714fb3c70f34d71a6eadef6a4ec43/zuul.d/zuul-legacy-project-templates.yaml#L10-L36
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/275fdb147a3281f77916f8550de954cf5f6a02c8/zuul.d/integrated-gate.yaml#L458-L482

Change-Id: I6a162d9011302de0df070cfa44386d545a578012

commit_message:
Add volume mounts required for NVMe-oF cinder backend

Add host_prep task and volume mounts so that services accessing
cinder's NVMe-oF backend have shared and persistent access to
the /etc/nvme directory. The directory and volume mounts are created
only when CinderEnableNVMeOFBackend is True (it defaults to False).

Change-Id: I343a58886fca3ed68f8cbc7c1824f7adff4ab4ca

commit_message:
Pure Storage - bump version numbers for 2023.2 (Bobcat)

Pure uses the version number of the driver to identify which
customers are using which versions of OpenStack.

This will help granular analysis of which driver is being
used in each OpenStack version

Change-Id: Ib507509cb20284706ffd204bbbaaf752bab56c80

commit_message:
Update url of "Unity Replication White Paper"

The website "www.emc.com" has been discontinued.

Replace the outdated link
"https://www.emc.com/collateral/white-papers/h15088-dell-emc-unity-replication-technologies.pdf"
with the link
"https://dl.dell.com/content/docu69886_dell-emc-unity-replication-technologies-a-detailed-review.pdf".

Change-Id: I3ab2cc28bef7524cec4f161c9d5417597df56b89

commit_message:
Update block-storage-overview to reflect multiattach

According to https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/admin/volume-multiattach.html,single volume can be attached to multiple
instances simultaneously in active/active or active/standby scenarios.

Closes-Bug: #2004419
Change-Id: I6f76bf99cc15947333645a0b19d530b21fba372f
Signed-off-by: Ajay Pal <ajay.pal.bisherwal@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/70/877070/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Prior to the Queens release, the Block Storage service did not provide a shared storage solution like NFS and you could attach a device to only one instance. However, with the introduction of Cinder multiattach, you can now attach a single volume to multiple instances simultaneously simultaneously in active/active or active/standby scenarios.
deleted_lines: The Block Storage service does not provide a shared storage solution like NFS. While traditionally, with the Block Storage service, you can attach a device to only one instance, the introduction of Cinder multiattach in the Queens release allows a single volume to be attached to multiple instances simultaneously in active/active or active/standby scenarios..

of classes intead of plan Mock() calls. In this patch, the Mock object

commit_message:
Improve test_execute_root_and_helper

Pass autospec=True while patching the function.
Create the mock object for mock_helper using mock.sentinel. This gives
us some extra protection because sentinel object is not callable. If the
code tries to use it like a function, it will raise a TypeError.
This patch also changes assertFalse() to assert_not_called().

Partial-Bug: #2004174
Change-Id: I209ff5d0fd7e3eaa0b50dcbf71ff4b0960403f96
Signed-off-by: Khadija Kamran <kamrankhadijadj@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/85/877185/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mock_helper = mock.Mock(spec=context.RequestContext)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/2023.1

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/2023.1.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/2023.1.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I390aa17aaf5c6e7fdd02fadbfeb13b36daaa8398

commit_message:
Update barbicanclient

The changes in version 5.5 barbicanclient cause breaking changes.
Changing which barbicanclient is used fixes this issue.

Story: 2010629
Task: 47581
Change-Id: I1b6b0a4c1960fb5cb6ce04ea755074944fe4bb6f
(cherry picked from commit 33ab4e9cb42e5a68019c16f6f6ecd679c8dca5ab)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/20/880820/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from barbicanclient import client as barbicanclient
deleted_lines: from barbicanclient.v1 import client as barbicanclient

commit_message:
Replate whitelist with allowlist

Someone upgraded tox at the gate and our jobs now fail
with the following message:

E failed with rm is not allowed, use allowlist_externals to allow it

The most practical choice is to remain enslaved by the
gate master here. The patch simply renames the key.

Change-Id: I44f290fe7246ffbf0689cd49df45554712dc274e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pycadf refs/changes/48/881248/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: allowlist_externals =

commit_message:
Hitachi HBSD: Fix invalid "raise None"

raise_error() already raises an exception, just
call it instead of raising its result.

Change-Id: I77eb5a6a1c62fbb3336b7b087e41e0b4f73a3f1d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/77/875977/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.raise_error(msg)

subject: Correct retry interval during attach volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-04-20 08:46:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/volume/test_cinder.py', 'nova/volume/cinder.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ab00f53caf645833fc3e82aa13036231bcaed57b', 'message': 'Correct retry interval during attach volume

When we try to simultaneously attach same volume multiple times
(multiattach), there are multiple attachments created, suppose
attachA and attachB. If attachA marks the volume "reserved" then
attachB can't proceed until the volume is in "in-use" or "available"
state. We retry until we reach any of these states for which we use
the retrying library.

Closes-Bug: #1968944
Change-Id: I69cd7ff13370624a23ea454172c5f5ff9b51b23c
'}]
commit_message:
Correct retry interval during attach volume

When we try to simultaneously attach same volume multiple times
(multiattach), there are multiple attachments created, suppose
attachA and attachB. If attachA marks the volume "reserved" then
attachB can't proceed until the volume is in "in-use" or "available"
state. We retry until we reach any of these states for which we use
the retrying library.

Closes-Bug: #1968944
Change-Id: I69cd7ff13370624a23ea454172c5f5ff9b51b23c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/21/880921/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @retrying.retry(stop_max_attempt_number=5, retry_on_exception=lambda e: type(e) == cinder_exception.BadRequest, wait_exponential_multiplier=1000, wait_exponential_max=10000)

commit_message:
Implement separated haproxy service config

All services placed behind haproxy include an additional playbook
responsible for creating their haproxy services.

Scope for some variables was changed to be more optimal.

Change-Id: I0eec358d982cc09dcb7e2c0045b9684c65876faf

commit_message:
Define blank _haproxy_service_configs_simplified

With current behavior, when haproxy role is imported multiple times in
the same playbook(by setup-openstack.yml as an example), variable
`_haproxy_service_configs_simplified` never gets purged so ansible just
keeps appending services this list.

To avoid this situation, `_haproxy_service_configs_simplified` has to be
explicitly defined as a blank list at the begining.

Change-Id: If62ec18842609957f09e0161a524fea88910ce9e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server refs/changes/81/880781/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Define blank _haproxy_service_configs_simplified variable set_fact: _haproxy_service_configs_simplified: [] _haproxy_service_configs_simplified: "{{ _haproxy_service_configs_simplified + [ (item.service is defined) | ternary(item.service, item) ] }}"

commit_message:
Switch back to use constrained Django version

Supposedly, Adjutant has upgraded used Django version and constrained
version can be used now, since upper limit for Django is not defined
anymore in project requirements [1]

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/adjutant/src/commit/df8c3e4a8b70be8697ac46f0acec9169752b4698/requirements.txt#L3

Change-Id: Ie5c4f5528a25d0a13c12749c1d7af09377792342

subject: DNM: Fix failure when creating a protected image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-04-20 02:29:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/image/v2/image.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/428187cc202cffda4346a9fc3e3f8f9c0e7d8383', 'message': 'DNM: Fix failure when creating a protected image

The following command:

$ openstack image create --protected imgname

Fails with the following error message, returned by glance-api:

BadRequestException: 400: Client Error for url:
http://192.168.121.187/image/v2/images, 400 Bad Request: Failed
validating 'type' in
schema['additionalProperties']:: On
instance['is_protected']:: Provided object does not match
schema 'image': True is not of type 'string':
{'type': 'string'}: True

That is because the Schema.validate() method in glance/schema.py is
working on the following input:

(Pdb) p obj
{'container_format': 'bare', 'name': 'imgname', 'disk_format': 'raw',
'is_protected': True, 'owner_specified.openstack.md5': '',
'owner_specified.openstack.sha256': '',
'owner_specified.openstack.object': 'images/imgname'}

Whereas, when using glanceclient with the following command:

$ glance image-create --protected True --name mygcimg

Schema.validate() is working on the following input:

{'protected': True, 'name': 'mygcimg'}

The Glance API is expecing 'protected', not 'is_protected'.

This patch fixes this specific issue, but a lot of tests are failing.
Fixing them all would probably require renaming "is_protected" to
"protected" in the openstacksdk as well.

Change-Id: I6618a0c933178d2109719b7f1468a1c04300142b
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Fix failure when creating a protected image

The following command:

$ openstack image create --protected imgname

Fails with the following error message, returned by glance-api:

BadRequestException: 400: Client Error for url:
http://192.168.121.187/image/v2/images, 400 Bad Request: Failed
validating 'type' in
schema['additionalProperties']:: On
instance['is_protected']:: Provided object does not match
schema 'image': True is not of type 'string':
{'type': 'string'}: True

That is because the Schema.validate() method in glance/schema.py is
working on the following input:

(Pdb) p obj
{'container_format': 'bare', 'name': 'imgname', 'disk_format': 'raw',
'is_protected': True, 'owner_specified.openstack.md5': '',
'owner_specified.openstack.sha256': '',
'owner_specified.openstack.object': 'images/imgname'}

Whereas, when using glanceclient with the following command:

$ glance image-create --protected True --name mygcimg

Schema.validate() is working on the following input:

{'protected': True, 'name': 'mygcimg'}

The Glance API is expecing 'protected', not 'is_protected'.

This patch fixes this specific issue, but a lot of tests are failing.
Fixing them all would probably require renaming "is_protected" to
"protected" in the openstacksdk as well.

Change-Id: I6618a0c933178d2109719b7f1468a1c04300142b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/00/880900/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dest="protected", dest="protected", if parsed_args.protected is not None: kwargs['protected'] = parsed_args.protected parsed_args.protected is not None protected=parsed_args.protected or False, 'protected', dest="protected", dest="protected", if parsed_args.protected is not None: kwargs['protected'] = parsed_args.protected
deleted_lines: dest="is_protected", dest="is_protected", if parsed_args.is_protected is not None: kwargs['is_protected'] = parsed_args.is_protected parsed_args.is_protected is not None protected=parsed_args.is_protected or False, 'is_protected', dest="is_protected", dest="is_protected", if parsed_args.is_protected is not None: kwargs['is_protected'] = parsed_args.is_protected

subject: updater: add memcache shard update lookup support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-02-22 05:20:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/d7bf7cf8d043b61ca50f21aab2bdc11c26c18454', 'message': "updater: add memcache shard update lookup support

When a root container gets under high load, the proxy can fail to get
the list of update shards and thereby writes the root account and
container as the destination for a container-update. However, this just
magnifies the load on the container, as once the obj is written the
object server will then go and attempt to update the container, which
will also fail, writing down the root container as the destination in
the written async pending.
The object-updater then picks it up and keeps trying to hit the root. We
basically start ddosing ourselves.

This patch plumbs in the swift memcache client into the object-updater.
And when enabled in config:

  use_memcache = True

The updater, when the target is a root container will first attempt to
look up the updating shards for the container in memcache. If found we
can bypass talking to the root container completely.
If the memcache list is outdated, at least we're talking to a shard and
it can give us a 301 redirect to the correct shard.

This assumes under heavy load to a particular container that a request
finally manages to update the updating shardranges in memcache, but
if that fails allows SRE to manually insert the update shard ranges into
the cache an eliviate much of the issues.

To accomplish this `get_cache_key` has been moved from
proxy/controller/base.py and into common/utils.py.

Change-Id: I8728adb10a9a5484147a7ca8f3441ffda4bd409d

commit_message:
updater: add memcache shard update lookup support

When a root container gets under high load, the proxy can fail to get
the list of update shards and thereby writes the root account and
container as the destination for a container-update. However, this just
magnifies the load on the container, as once the obj is written the
object server will then go and attempt to update the container, which
will also fail, writing down the root container as the destination in
the written async pending.
The object-updater then picks it up and keeps trying to hit the root. We
basically start ddosing ourselves.

This patch plumbs in the swift memcache client into the object-updater.
And when enabled in config:

  use_memcache = True

The updater, when the target is a root container will first attempt to
look up the updating shards for the container in memcache. If found we
can bypass talking to the root container completely.
If the memcache list is outdated, at least we're talking to a shard and
it can give us a 301 redirect to the correct shard.

This assumes under heavy load to a particular container that a request
finally manages to update the updating shardranges in memcache, but
if that fails allows SRE to manually insert the update shard ranges into
the cache an eliviate much of the issues.

Change-Id: I8728adb10a9a5484147a7ca8f3441ffda4bd409d

added_lines: MetricsPrefixLoggerAdapter, get_cache_key
deleted_lines: MetricsPrefixLoggerAdapterdef get_cache_key(account, container=None, obj=None, shard=None): """ Get the keys for both memcache and env['swift.infocache'] (cache_key) where info about accounts, containers, and objects is cached :param account: The name of the account :param container: The name of the container (or None if account) :param obj: The name of the object (or None if account or container) :param shard: Sharding state for the container query; typically 'updating' or 'listing' (Requires account and container; cannot use with obj) :returns: a (native) string cache_key """ if six.PY2: def to_native(s): if s is None or isinstance(s, str): return s return s.encode('utf8') else: def to_native(s): if s is None or isinstance(s, str): return s return s.decode('utf8', 'surrogateescape') account = to_native(account) container = to_native(container) obj = to_native(obj) if shard: if not (account and container): raise ValueError('Shard cache key requires account and container') if obj: raise ValueError('Shard cache key cannot have obj') cache_key = 'shard-%s/%s/%s' % (shard, account, container) elif obj: if not (account and container): raise ValueError('Object cache key requires account and container') cache_key = 'object/%s/%s/%s' % (account, container, obj) elif container: if not account: raise ValueError('Container cache key requires account') cache_key = 'container/%s/%s' % (account, container) else: cache_key = 'account/%s' % account # Use a unique environment cache key per account and one container. # This allows caching both account and container and ensures that when we # copy this env to form a new request, it won't accidentally reuse the # old container or account info return cache_key

commit_message:
Add share network subnet resource to shared file system

Introduce Share Network Subnet Class with
basic methods including list, get, create
and delete to shared file system storage
service.

Co-Authored-By: Reynaldo Bontje <rey.bontje80@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I781eb8d19c6af8097c9de4293bb975361e524344
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/82/783582/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from openstack.shared_file_system.v2 import share_network_subnet as SNS from openstack.tests.unit import base IDENTIFIER = '9cd5a59f-4d22-496f-8b1a-ea4860c24d39' EXAMPLE = { "id": IDENTIFIER, "availability_zone": None, "share_network_id": "9b47ccd1-7f59-47be-a7eb-740e227461db", "share_network_name": None, "created_at": "2021-02-24T02:45:59.000000", "segmentation_id": None, "neutron_subnet_id": None, "updated_at": None, "neutron_net_id": None, "ip_version": None, "cidr": None, "network_type": None, "mtu": None, "gateway": None } class TestShareNetworkSubnet(base.TestCase): def test_basic(self): SNS_resource = SNS.ShareNetworkSubnet() self.assertEqual('share-network-subnets', SNS_resource.resources_key) self.assertEqual('/share-networks/%(share_network_id)s/subnets', SNS_resource.base_path) self.assertTrue(SNS_resource.allow_list) def test_make_share_network_subnet(self): SNS_resource = SNS.ShareNetworkSubnet(**EXAMPLE) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['id'], SNS_resource.id) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['availability_zone'], SNS_resource.availability_zone) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['share_network_id'], SNS_resource.share_network_id) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['share_network_name'], SNS_resource.share_network_name) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['created_at'], SNS_resource.created_at) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['segmentation_id'], SNS_resource.segmentation_id) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['neutron_subnet_id'], SNS_resource.neutron_subnet_id) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['updated_at'], SNS_resource.updated_at) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['neutron_net_id'], SNS_resource.neutron_net_id) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['ip_version'], SNS_resource.ip_version) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['cidr'], SNS_resource.cidr) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['network_type'], SNS_resource.network_type) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['mtu'], SNS_resource.mtu) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['gateway'], SNS_resource.gateway)

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2023-03-21 20:57:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/519fcc3426931aeffa184b382530ee7efd4080a0', 'message': 'Modify the create/fetch method of the base resource to
support different request/response keys.

Change-Id: I9d928a55539c17ab54d983165afc7912cd0926f8
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2023-03-27 16:40:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/59486311c4030b944aaca6ff52f6fd49a5a019d5', 'message': 'Allow key overrides in create and fetch methods

Provides override  arguments so that subresources that require different envelope/resource keys for requests/responses don't need to override base resource methods in a hacky manner. It also makes it so subresources don't need to "reinvent the wheel" as often by making custom request/response processing. These two patterns are relatively common and are often caused by the need to override these resource/envelope keys. For the sake of consistency across the SDK, this patch moves the logic needed in these cases into the base resource.

Change-Id: I9d928a55539c17ab54d983165afc7912cd0926f8
'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2023-03-29 15:32:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/d4c74756c69dde94affc4c5afb49d9eb4a42ffd3', 'message': 'Allow key overrides in create and fetch methods

Provides override  arguments so that subresources that require different envelope/resource keys for requests/responses don't need to override base resource methods in a hacky manner. It also makes it so subresources don't need to "reinvent the wheel" as often by making custom request/response processing. These two patterns are relatively common and are often caused by the need to override these resource/envelope keys. For the sake of consistency across the SDK, this patch moves the logic needed in these cases into the base resource.

Change-Id: I9d928a55539c17ab54d983165afc7912cd0926f8

commit_message:
Allow key overrides in create and fetch methods

Provides override  arguments so that subresources that require different envelope/resource keys for requests/responses don't need to override base resource methods in a hacky manner. It also makes it so subresources don't need to "reinvent the wheel" as often by making custom request/response processing. These two patterns are relatively common and are often caused by the need to override these resource/envelope keys. For the sake of consistency across the SDK, this patch moves the logic needed in these cases into the base resource.

Change-Id: I9d928a55539c17ab54d983165afc7912cd0926f8

commit_message:
Remove authenticate.failed from the notification_opt_out list

authenticate.failed in the list is not working as the correct
notification is authenticate.failure (see [0]), this way we keep the
default behaviour, and the users still have the ability to add their
events to this list at deployment time.

[0]https://github.com/openstack/pycadf/blob/stable/victoria/pycadf/cadftaxonomy.py#L76

Change-Id: If3d818dac220a105f4aba382537c09ab4ee1abd5
Closes-Bug: 1954665

commit_message:
Allow custom console=tty0 argument

The bootloader element now has variable
DIB_BOOTLOADER_VIRTUAL_TERMINAL to customize or suppress the
console=tty0 kernel argument.

This is proposed to allow console=tty0 to be removed entirely as it is
causing significant performance degredation in DPDK environments.

Change-Id: Iba2ee5b8a6b4acdd236a770550dffd29c784ce11
Related: rhbz#2179366

commit_message:
fix(federation): allow using numerical group names

When using a numerical group name, the current codebase which
relies on ast.literal_eval does not account for the value
being a number.  Therefore, it can be parsed as a number and
fail in further steps since it will not be a list.

This patch adds a test to handle that use case and refactor the
code that leverages ast.literal_eval to be the same everywhere
so that it adds that fix everywhere.

Closes-Bug: #1992186
Change-Id: I665b7e0234650ba07e0d030a2d442d6599d0888a

If the groups list has only one group, test if the transformation is done correctly """ mapping = mapping_fixtures.MAPPING_GROUPS_WITH_EMAIL assertion = mapping_fixtures.GROUPS_ASSERTION_ONLY_ONE_NUMERICAL_GROUP rp = mapping_utils.RuleProcessor(FAKE_MAPPING_ID, mapping['rules']) mapped_properties = rp.process(assertion) self.assertIsNotNone(mapped_properties) self.assertEqual('jsmith', mapped_properties['user']['name']) self.assertEqual('jill@example.com', mapped_properties['user']['email']) self.assertEqual('1234', mapped_properties['group_names'][0]['name'])

commit_message:
Remove the ``OVNSqlFixture`` class workaround

This patch reverts [1], that was inherited during the ML2/OVN
migration to this repository. The Neutron functional CI is
stable without this workaround.

Related-Bug: #1808146
Change-Id: I466e4369374f0cf2b59fd5145f5a9b2dc5aaaa51

Change-Id: Ia243368a9d68aca3a717fb2be1da99bceb271e56

commit_message:
Don't use deprecated config opt name in unit test

With cinder change Iccfbe62406b6, the 'iscsi_secondary_ip_addresses'
opt was deprecated in favor of 'target_secondary_ip_addresses'.  This
broke a cinderlib unit test that checked to see if a mocked logger
was not called (which it now was, to log a deprecation message).  Use
the current option name in the test so that the test continues to
test what it was designed to test (i.e., cinderlib config loading,
not oslo.config option deprecation).

Change-Id: Ia243368a9d68aca3a717fb2be1da99bceb271e56

commit_message:
Migrate 'server event *' commands to SDK

This one is tricky since the ServerAction resources includes a nested
ServerActionEvent resource which requires a custom formatter in order
for things to render as expected.

Change-Id: I3d24851303222af9efcee8d7e1565278b1018efd
Co-authored-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/18/863718/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #compute_client = self.app.client_manager.sdk_connection.compute # server_id = compute_client.find_server( parsed_args.server).id #data = compute_client.get_server(server_id).list(instance_action) compute_client = self.app.client_manager.sdk_connection.compute #server_id = utils.find_resource( # compute_client.servers, parsed_args.server, #).id server_id = compute_client.find_server( parsed_args.server).id # action_detail = compute_client.instance_action.get( # server_id, parsed_args.request_id # ) action_detail = compute_client.get_server_action(parsed_args.request_id, server_id)
deleted_lines: compute_client = self.app.client_manager.compute server_id = utils.find_resource( compute_client.servers, parsed_args.server, ).id action_detail = compute_client.instance_action.get( server_id, parsed_args.request_id )

subject: tests: Fix test_cleanup_ondisk_files_commit_window
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-04-20 19:53:00.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/105727bc8961e1cd263d0edd00c7f9ce46dacd2c', 'message': 'tests: Fix test_cleanup_ondisk_files_commit_window

`much_older` has to be much older than `older`, or the test gets
flakey. See

- test_cleanup_ondisk_files_reclaim_non_data_files,
- test_cleanup_ondisk_files_reclaim_with_data_files, and
- test_cleanup_ondisk_files_reclaim_with_data_files_legacy_durable

for a more standard definition of "much_older".

Closes-Bug: #2017024
Change-Id: I1eaa501827f4475ddc0c20d82cf0a6d4a5e98f75
'}]
commit_message:
tests: Fix test_cleanup_ondisk_files_commit_window

`much_older` has to be much older than `older`, or the test gets
flakey. See

- test_cleanup_ondisk_files_reclaim_non_data_files,
- test_cleanup_ondisk_files_reclaim_with_data_files, and
- test_cleanup_ondisk_files_reclaim_with_data_files_legacy_durable

for a more standard definition of "much_older".

Closes-Bug: #2017024
Change-Id: I1eaa501827f4475ddc0c20d82cf0a6d4a5e98f75
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/42/881142/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: much_older = Timestamp(time() - 2000).internal

commit_message:
Stop using Storyboard for Kayobe

Kolla community decided [1] to stop using Storyboard for tracking
bugs and tasks for Kayobe. New Launchpad project named 'Kayobe'
has been created [2].
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kayobe/+/878776
[2] https://launchpad.net/kayobe

Change-Id: I5df4592259236a53dbdccc62eefa996bc41d2391

commit_message:
Stop using Storyboard for ovn-bgp-agent

The ovn-bgp-agent team decided to drop the use of storyboard in favor of
launchpad to be more aligned with other projects under the Neutron
governance.

Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Iad689867451d8091451783c70565234641b6e4b3

commit_message:
Enable jammy-antelope voting and drop kinetic-zed tests

* Voting was turned on for jammy-antelope in the
  project-template for charm-functional-jobs in zosci-config
* Voting for jammy-antelope bundles with non-standard names
  is turned on in individual charms
* Kinetic-zed bundles/tests are removed

Change-Id: I4efc0e7fb5eb1a8de43e5ac5fe62cf661ff08a7b
(cherry picked from commit 035ab02dc9f5bc3834e4ce1e51d831d672f6ecff)

commit_message:
Set packages in setup.cfg

Without this, "tox -e py38" fails with an error from
setuptools:
    error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in
    a flat-layout: ['etc', 'os_brick', 'releasenotes'].

Change-Id: Icd68f845d83df2d4875e61a7e92630e73e4564c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/92/876992/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [options] packages = os_brick

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-04-20 17:23:11.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/image/v2/_proxy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/79bcc220b586a302e86f16fce6a47122e65eb062', 'message': "image: Handle legacy 'is_public' property uniformly

commit_message:
image: Handle legacy 'is_public' property uniformly

We were only handling this if you created an image with data. There was
no reason for this. Correct our mistake.

Change-Id: Ie968d3bad8b29e0cede80a58728097e65730f752
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/34/881034/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We can never have nice things. Glance v1 took "is_public" as a # boolean. Glance v2 takes "visibility". If the user gives us # is_public, we know what they mean. If they give us visibility, they # know that they mean. if 'is_public' in kwargs['properties']: is_public = kwargs['properties'].pop('is_public') if is_public: kwargs['visibility'] = 'public' else: kwargs['visibility'] = 'private'
deleted_lines: # We can never have nice things. Glance v1 took "is_public" as a # boolean. Glance v2 takes "visibility". If the user gives us # is_public, we know what they mean. If they give us visibility, they # know that they mean. if 'is_public' in kwargs['properties']: is_public = kwargs['properties'].pop('is_public') if is_public: kwargs['visibility'] = 'public' else: kwargs['visibility'] = 'private'

commit_message:
Enable jammy-antelope voting and drop kinetic-zed tests

* Voting was turned on for jammy-antelope in the
  project-template for charm-functional-jobs in zosci-config
* Voting for jammy-antelope bundles with non-standard names
  is turned on in individual charms
* Kinetic-zed bundles/tests are removed
* Add libpython3-dev to allow the charm to be built. This
  fixes a missing dependency with Cython.
* Add pkg-config to the charmcraft.yaml for builds. This
  is required by rust to build cryptography.

Change-Id: Icdba21a8865f3cdfd977d08a94386050b6c5a8c4
(cherry picked from commit 598826bac8d2d4d0f9bfbfd0b5a187d6e03c706a)

subject: Add get_*_by_id() methods for Magnum clusters and templates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-02-10 20:50:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/4864d249333047534ba30b59c0ff8f8781e37261', 'message': "Add get_*_by_id() methods for Magnum clusters and templates

Magnum provides very different information based on whether we search
clusters (using GET against the /clusters endpoint), vs. directly
looking them up (using /clusters/<id>). Most notably, the cluster's
API address is absent from the former method, and is only available
for the latter.

Arguably, someone spinning up a cluster from the SDK might be
interested in subsequently interacting with it using the Kubernetes
API, so that information might be relevant.

Thus, add a get_coe_cluster_by_id() method, so that Connection objects
configured with use_direct_get=True can look up a cluster by ID, and
get the richer data set.

In addition, since the same considerations apply to cluster template
lookup, add a get_cluster_template_by_id() method as well.

Change-Id: I6eee95d59f40022368193c963c038640eca6c309

commit_message:
Add get_*_by_id() methods for Magnum clusters and templates

Magnum provides very different information based on whether we search
clusters (using GET against the /clusters endpoint), vs. directly
looking them up (using /clusters/<id>). Most notably, the cluster's
API address is absent from the former method, and is only available
for the latter.

Arguably, someone spinning up a cluster from the SDK might be
interested in subsequently interacting with it using the Kubernetes
API, so that information might be relevant.

Thus, add a get_coe_cluster_by_id() method, so that Connection objects
configured with use_direct_get=True can look up a cluster by ID, and
get the richer data set.

In addition, since the same considerations apply to cluster template
lookup, add a get_cluster_template_by_id() method as well.

Reference information:
https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/container-infrastructure-management/

Change-Id: I6eee95d59f40022368193c963c038640eca6c309
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/91/828791/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @_utils.cache_on_arguments() def get_coe_cluster_by_id(self, id): """Get a single COE cluster. :param id: cluster UUID :returns: a dict containing the cluster :raises: ``OpenStackCloudException``: if something goes wrong during the OpenStack API call. """ with _utils.shade_exceptions("Error fetching cluster"): data = self._container_infra_client.get(f'/clusters/{id}') return self._normalize_coe_cluster(data) @_utils.cache_on_arguments() def get_cluster_template_by_id(self, id): """Get a single COE cluster template. :param id: cluster template UUID :returns: a dict containing the cluster template :raises: ``OpenStackCloudException``: if something goes wrong during the OpenStack API call. """ with _utils.shade_exceptions("Error fetching cluster template"): data = self._container_infra_client.get(f'/clustertemplates/{id}') return self._normalize_cluster_template(data)

commit_message:
Remove six

This is no longer necessary since we only support Python 3.x.

A note is removed from requirements.txt since it's no longer relevant:
pip 20.3+ has a real dependency resolver.

Change-Id: Ie3006813a79fef1f128d388b906e4f1752347fa4
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Grzegorz Grasza <xek@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add support for deprecated nova hosts

Somebody might be willing to get some support for hosts even it is
deprecated now. Let's add at least something.

Change-Id: I9006c12e02dfe623ec48e846c9d0bdb530812d2e

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from openstack import resource as _resource from openstack import exceptions class Host(_resource.Resource): """Resource for the compute hosts (deprecated as of 2.43). It is implemented here to provide support in the openstackclient for users of the older clouds. """ resource_key = 'host' resources_key = 'hosts' base_path = '/os-hosts' # capabilities allow_fetch = True allow_list = True allow_commit = True _query_mapping = _resource.QueryParameters( "zone", "host_name", "service", ) # Setting max microversion to the last supported level _max_microversion = '2.42' # Properties #: The name of the host. host = _resource.Body('host') #: Mode of maintenance state, either enable or disable. maintenance_mode = _resource.Body('maintenance_mode') #: The name of this flavor. name = _resource.Body('host_name', alternate_id=True, alias='host') #: The resource info of the host. resources = _resource.Body('resources', type=list, list_item=dict) #: The name of the service which is running on the host. service = _resource.Body('service') #: The status of the host, either enable or disable. status = _resource.Body('status') #: The available zone of the host. zone = _resource.Body('zone') def _translate_fetch_response( self, response, has_body=None, error_message=None ): if has_body is None: has_body = self.has_body exceptions.raise_from_response(response, error_message=error_message) if has_body: try: body = response.json() # NOTE(gtema): in the fetch we get single entry "host" as a # list of resources host = body.pop('host', []) body['resources'] = [] for resource in host: body['resources'].append(resource['resource']) body_attrs = self._consume_body_attrs(body) self._body.attributes.update(body_attrs) self._body.clean() except ValueError: # Server returned not parse-able response (202, 204, etc) # Do simply nothing pass self._update_location() dict.update(self, self.to_dict()) def fetch(self, session, requires_id=True, base_path=None, error_message=None, **params): """Get a remote resource based on this instance. :param session: The session to use for making this request. :type session: :class:`~keystoneauth1.adapter.Adapter` :param boolean requires_id: A boolean indicating whether resource ID should be part of the requested URI. :param str base_path: Base part of the URI for fetching resources, if different from :data:`~openstack.resource.Resource.base_path`. :param str error_message: An Error message to be returned if requested object does not exist. :param dict params: Additional parameters that can be consumed. :return: This :class:`Resource` instance. :raises: :exc:`~openstack.exceptions.MethodNotSupported` if :data:`Resource.allow_fetch` is not set to ``True``. :raises: :exc:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceNotFound` if the resource was not found. """ if not self.allow_fetch: raise exceptions.MethodNotSupported(self, "fetch") request = self._prepare_request(requires_id=requires_id, base_path=base_path) session = self._get_session(session) microversion = self._get_microversion_for(session, 'fetch') response = session.get(request.url, microversion=microversion, params=params) kwargs = {} if error_message: kwargs['error_message'] = error_message self.microversion = microversion self._translate_fetch_response(response, **kwargs) return self

commit_message:
Enable jammy-antelope voting and drop kinetic-zed tests

* Voting was turned on for jammy-antelope in the
  project-template for charm-functional-jobs in zosci-config
* Voting for jammy-antelope bundles with non-standard names
  is turned on in individual charms
* Kinetic-zed bundles/tests are removed

Change-Id: I45bf4ef2d0fc1323132804c7a89cc42a768d18a8
(cherry picked from commit b92515f4b192c6b9bc0d2866079c759a4aef9ab1)

commit_message:
load_balancer proxy _find _delete now accept attrs

Now proxy methods for load balancer such as _find and _delete can use additional parameters.
To change base_path, for example.

Change-Id: I263b92fa4d055a87a442251fd22a73481f34e998

commit_message:
Enable jammy-antelope voting and drop kinetic-zed tests

* Voting was turned on for jammy-antelope in the
  project-template for charm-functional-jobs in zosci-config
* Voting for jammy-antelope bundles with non-standard names
  is turned on in individual charms
* Kinetic-zed bundles/tests are removed

Change-Id: I463ac3b04112941489a5211f75e8e24db0aa82e0
(cherry picked from commit 4c6cef4b700d83201b82e1935c8d29be5ba1438f)

commit_message:
Add support to retrieve vm instance actionlogs via Openstack REST API at https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=list-actions-for-server-detail

Closes-Bug: #2009678
Change-Id: Iae82eabb42f450501cf2ead8c5e2edf2cd32e26b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/50/817850/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack.compute.v2 import server_osinstanceactions as _server_osinstanceactions def get_server_osinstanceactions(self, server): """Get a single server action logs :param server: This parameter need to be specified when ServerInterface ID is given as value. It can be either the ID of a server or a :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server.Server` instance that the interface belongs to. :returns: One :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server_osinstanceactions.ServerOSInstanceActions`` :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceNotFound` when no resource can be found. """ server_id = self._get_resource(_server.Server, server).id return self._get(_server_osinstanceactions.ServerOSInstanceActions, server_id=server_id, requires_id=False)

added_lines: from openstack.compute.v2 import server_actions as _server_actions def get_server_actions(self, server): """Get a single server action logs :param server: This parameter need to be specified when ServerInterface ID is given as value. It can be either the ID of a server or a :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server.Server` instance that the interface belongs to. :returns: One :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server_actions.ServerActions`` :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceNotFound` when no resource can be found. """ server_id = self._get_resource(_server.Server, server).id return self._get(_server_actions.ServerActions, server_id=server_id, requires_id=False)

commit_message:
Enable jammy-antelope voting and drop kinetic-zed tests

* Voting was turned on for jammy-antelope in the
  project-template for charm-functional-jobs in zosci-config
* Voting for jammy-antelope bundles with non-standard names
  is turned on in individual charms
* Kinetic-zed bundles/tests are removed
* Add libpython3-dev to allow the charm to be built. This
  fixes a missing dependency with Cython

Change-Id: I90a8235e29b42d6cd445ead387ae531988b578e6

commit_message:
Enable jammy-antelope voting and drop kinetic-zed tests

* Voting was turned on for jammy-antelope in the
  project-template for charm-functional-jobs in zosci-config
* Voting for jammy-antelope bundles with non-standard names
  is turned on in individual charms
* Kinetic-zed bundles/tests are removed

Change-Id: I57df3d1f01049a9b4b12c970cf83abffb7b4ed64
(cherry picked from commit 7bd535068d7489816092ca8afc92d343bc326883)

commit_message:
Remove USE_PYTHON3 setting from .zuul.yaml

We don't need this anymore since all of our jobs are
Python 3.

Change-Id: Ib7e85a72a28ff507cb1371b365b6bfa5fbf70d81

commit_message:
Enable jammy-antelope voting and drop kinetic-zed tests

* Voting was turned on for jammy-antelope in the
  project-template for charm-functional-jobs in zosci-config
* Voting for jammy-antelope bundles with non-standard names
  is turned on in individual charms
* Kinetic-zed bundles/tests are removed
* Add libpython3-dev to allow the charm to be built. This
  fixes a missing dependency with Cython

commit_message:
Enable jammy-antelope voting and drop kinetic-zed tests

* Voting was turned on for jammy-antelope in the
  project-template for charm-functional-jobs in zosci-config
* Voting for jammy-antelope bundles with non-standard names
  is turned on in individual charms
* Kinetic-zed bundles/tests are removed

Change-Id: I0236382ca3078c0434ad67fc33ba759baf066c93
(cherry picked from commit eb42d7a6843012b32d57bbefd951f9e6ca208a31)

commit_message:
Enable jammy-antelope voting and drop kinetic-zed tests

* Voting was turned on for jammy-antelope in the
  project-template for charm-functional-jobs in zosci-config
* Voting for jammy-antelope bundles with non-standard names
  is turned on in individual charms
* Kinetic-zed bundles/tests are removed
* Add libpython3-dev to allow the charm to be built. This
  fixes a missing dependency with Cython
* Use local charm overlay for HA config instead of manually
  managing symlinks.

Change-Id: Iaee9a3792f5ba1b39b1ea030938c84d107d7d227

  is turned on in individual charms
* Kinetic-zed bundles/tests are removed
* Add libpython3-dev to allow the charm to be built. This
  fixes a missing dependency with Cython
* Add pkg-config to the charmcraft.yaml for builds. This
  is required by rust to build cryptography.

Change-Id: Ib27d8d5cd14493a619c784a348cf14e424992053
(cherry picked from commit 579aaade7dbee1c57e6bb5da987a78f5a50e1781)

commit_message:
Speed up validate with skipping rebuilding sdist

NOT a solution: we need to build multiple times because we need the req
files from different hashes...

Change-Id: I2169605c6d6fe559e3de0fcaff5d4004db4f6334

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I2447df95b05fcd4f133f8c4d278c6284a67eb0b7

commit_message:
Replace abc.abstractproperty with property and abc.abstractmethod

Replace abc.abstractproperty with property and abc.abstractmethod,
as abc.abstractproperty has been deprecated since python3.3[1]

[1]https://docs.python.org/3.8/whatsnew/3.3.html?highlight=deprecated#abc

Change-Id: I506bd4f17d9c86d1a0328e765e8c695c76e16f18

commit_message:
Enable jammy-antelope voting and drop kinetic-zed tests

* Voting was turned on for jammy-antelope in the
  project-template for charm-functional-jobs in zosci-config
* Voting for jammy-antelope bundles with non-standard names
  is turned on in individual charms
* Kinetic-zed bundles/tests are removed
* Add libpython3-dev to allow the charm to be built. This
  fixes a missing dependency with Cython.
* Add pkg-config to the charmcraft.yaml for builds. This
  is required by rust to build cryptography.

Change-Id: I924bf717a6987d7b666f9ade1b8c5832df359dd6
(cherry picked from commit 298f5a15d4de7346b206ac90fa33457532a3041e)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/zed

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/zed.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/zed.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: Ia0d14f0955504bdeb41c1eff4d6854293e1f3430

commit_message:
Enable jammy-antelope voting and drop kinetic-zed tests

* Voting was turned on for jammy-antelope in the
  project-template for charm-functional-jobs in zosci-config
* Voting for jammy-antelope bundles with non-standard names
  is turned on in individual charms
* Kinetic-zed bundles/tests are removed
* Add libpython3-dev to allow the charm to be built. This
  fixes a missing dependency with Cython
* Remove wheelhouse pin of flit_core to avoid install hook
  failure.
* Rename overlay file to local-charm-overlay.yaml.j2 to avoid
  need for release-sepcific symlink overlay files.

Change-Id: I14ec64542f3a51adf9b32c6c2687023762f3210d
(cherry picked from commit bd6cb347c5499ba3cf4b7b334986a8ec4d772694)

subject: Allow federation to work with unversioned auth_url
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-11-30 17:01:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth/commit/8788c6b5c6834cb37b60936d4ec0b91292f68cc3', 'message': "Allow federation to work with unversioned auth_url

while e.g. V3Password works perfectly fine with unversioned auth_url
like 'http://keystone', everything based on FederationBaseAuth
does not and only requires versioned v3 auth_url.

Since OS_FEDERATION is implemented only in v3, this patch
makes sure that federated_token_url has v3 in it, thus allowing
for unversoned auth_url as well.

Change-Id: I1f0b00b6f721c53bb5308e03223d0c1564ca81b3

commit_message:
Allow federation to work with unversioned auth_url

while e.g. V3Password works perfectly fine with unversioned auth_url
like 'http://keystone', everything based on FederationBaseAuth
does not and only requires versioned v3 auth_url.

Since OS_FEDERATION is implemented only in v3, this patch
makes sure that federated_token_url has v3 in it, thus allowing
for unversoned auth_url as well.

Closes-Bug: #1998366
Change-Id: I1f0b00b6f721c53bb5308e03223d0c1564ca81b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/89/866189/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_federated_url_unversioned(self): plugin = self.get_plugin(auth_url="http://keystone/") self.assertEqual(self.token_url, plugin.federated_token_url)

commit_message:
doc: update setup.cfg file

Add updating the setup.cfg to reflect the current cycle's supported
Python versions to the release cycle tasks list.

Change-Id: I3e309edaa8d4ed9251e91398ff956323f11b1b31
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/96/876996/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Check the ``setup.cfg`` file in each cinder deliverable to make sure that the claimed supported Python versions line up with the cycle's supported Python versions.

commit_message:
Fix build

Add libpython3-dev to the list of the build-packages, this is needed
since https://github.com/juju-solutions/layer-basic/pull/214 .

Change-Id: I0499d6c3c7dac72525cd93a9fd96e2ed9f6d62f3
(cherry picked from commit 24ed3700b7bcd02d44d60e7cb2e5127023b30e94)

commit_message:
Add dependencies with native components as binary packages

The build time is very long because of PIP having to fetch and build
native components of the libraries. This change show a possible way to
bypass this issue. This has implication regarding the platform it's
running on. In this case, we know the charm is going to be run on a
22.04 container.

Change-Id: Iaa80861fd7b628d7199fcd575f05fe28c7ef7a16

commit_message:
Remove the CLI code from the Neutron client.

This project no longer provides CLI support. All code has been
removed. Please use openstack CLI instead

This patch removes entry point for neutron CLI too, bash completion
script and CLI related functional and unit tests but it
still keeps neutronclient/neutron/v2_0 module as this is used by e.g.
Nova.

Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #2003861
Change-Id: I5b6c735d1ff931d7991a42b262e7faa47b75edeb

deleted_lines: # Copyright 2016 NEC Corporation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from neutronclient.tests.functional import base class CLICommonFeatureTest(base.ClientTestBase): def test_tenant_id_shown_in_list_by_admin(self): nets = self.parser.table(self.neutron('net-list')) self.assertIn('tenant_id', nets['headers']) def test_tenant_id_not_shown_in_list_with_columns(self): nets = self.parser.table(self.neutron('net-list -c id -c name')) self.assertNotIn('tenant_id', nets['headers']) self.assertListEqual(['id', 'name'], nets['headers']) def test_tenant_id_not_shown_in_list_by_non_admin(self): output = self.neutron_non_admin('net-list') self.assertNotIn('tenant_id', self.parser.table(output)['headers']) self.assertTableStruct(self.parser.listing(output), ['id', 'name'])

commit_message:
RBD: Skip update_features when features = 0

librbd errors when update_features is called w/
features = 0 -- when this situation would occur,
skip calling update_features.

Closes-Bug: #1997980
Change-Id: Iab6a990ce7dee2c13deb4f46aeec0f46ffb7cd62

commit_message:
[swift] Transition Xena to EM

This transition the stable/xena branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch after the transition.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is April 20th, 2023.

Change-Id: I58a08512db162b05a1f86fb70078d825cc946ff6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/91/878891/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final

commit_message:
[sahara] Transition Xena to EM

This transition the stable/xena branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch after the transition.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is April 20th, 2023.

Change-Id: Ic42afcecf7438fcd13d66d3a31b3f533ffdd187d

commit_message:
ext-gw-multihoming: api-def and api-ref

API additions for [1].

* Added a new router attribute: external_gateways;
* Added new API definitions for:
    PUT add_external_gateways
    PUT update_external_gateways
    PUT remove_external_gateways
* Added extensions for each of the new router-level attributes:
  * enable_default_route_ecmp
  * enable_default_route_bfd
* Combined the validation logic for the external_gateway_info type
  across extensions (l3_ext_gw_mode, qos_gateway_ip and the new
  extension called l3_ext_gw_multihoming).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-specs/+/870030/

Change-Id: I2618475636b2bb9bfd743a62f5d4859d4f68a547
Related-Bug: #2002687

deleted_lines: from neutron_lib.api import validators if validators.validate_range(convert_to_int(data), [0, 255]) is None:

commit_message:
[kolla] Transition Xena to EM

This transition the stable/xena branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch after the transition.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is April 20th, 2023.

Change-Id: I37db8ea654bd48bb5263e1857ac79dffef8fffc6

commit_message:
Add new filter `host_name` to segment list

Add command parameter support to segment list command to filter out
segments based on host input parameter.

Change-Id: I95aaaf38dd57367d18748111281f531e9e9a1d12
Depends-On: I54df91cbd84482368b45163b1243cdefd051c97a

commit_message:
Add missing member options for designate

Noticed when testing TLS-e, designate is missing the general member
options in the related haproxy configuration.

Change-Id: Ib3833d47efe23700c5179c80309dd366e82f0240

added_lines: import base64 import json import ops_sunbeam.test_utils as test_utils class TestCharm(test_utils.CharmTestCase): PATCHES = ["subprocess"] charm_config=config_data, def initial_setup(self): rel_id = self.harness.add_relation("certificates", "vault") self.harness.add_relation_unit(rel_id, "vault/0") self.harness.update_config({"snap-channel": "essex/stable"}) self.harness.begin_with_initial_hooks() csr = {"certificate_signing_request": test_utils.TEST_CSR} self.harness.update_relation_data( rel_id, self.harness.charm.unit.name, { "ingress-address": "10.0.0.34", "certificate_signing_requests": json.dumps([csr]), }, ) test_utils.add_certificates_relation_certs(self.harness, rel_id) ovs_rel_id = self.harness.add_relation("ovsdb-cms", "ovn-relay") self.harness.add_relation_unit(ovs_rel_id, "ovn-relay/0") self.harness.update_relation_data( ovs_rel_id, "ovn-relay/0", { "bound-address": "10.1.176.143", "bound-hostname": "ovn-relay-0.ovn-relay-endpoints.openstack.svc.cluster.local", "egress-subnets": "10.20.21.10/32", "ingress-address": "10.20.21.10", "ingress-bound-address": "10.20.21.10", "private-address": "10.20.21.10", }, ) self.initial_setup() ["snap", "install", "openstack-hypervisor", "--channel", "essex/stable"] ) test_utils.add_complete_amqp_relation(self.harness) test_utils.add_complete_identity_credentials_relation(self.harness) metadata = self.harness.charm.metadata_secret() ovn_cacert = test_utils.TEST_CA + "\n" + "\n".join(test_utils.TEST_CHAIN) ovn_cacert = base64.b64encode(ovn_cacert.encode()).decode() private_key = base64.b64encode( self.harness.charm.contexts().certificates.key.encode() ).decode() certificate = base64.b64encode(test_utils.TEST_SERVER_CERT.encode()).decode() expect_settings = [ "compute.cpu-mode=host-model", "compute.spice-proxy-address=10.0.0.206", "compute.virt-type=kvm", commit_message:
Do not forcefully re-apply network config

Currently network configs are reapplied in all nodes during node
provisioning with --network-config or network provisioning. This is
because the network-config playbook forcefully override the flag to
run network configuration tasks.

This removes that override so that we by default do not reapply network
configurations to avoid network disruptions in existing nodes. Users
can still forcefully apply network configurations by setting
the tripleo_network_config_update var.

Resolves: rhbz#2181107
Change-Id: Ia61ccdbcb43ff69b002dce85f80db438c5904587
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/93/879093/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: vars: # The conditions here are when we want to apply the # NetworkConfig. They are: # - If tripleo_network_config_update is True # - Or the previous run of NetworkConfig failed. # - Or it has never run # This will match the prior behavior of when a Heat # SoftwareDeployment was used. # It also ensures the script does exist as a sine qua non # condition tripleo_network_config_update: True
